Angola, Indiana, June 6, 1912.

To whom it may Concern:

I take great pleasure in writing this statement for Mr. 
S. C. Buk, who is now a student in this Institution. He is a perfect 
gentleman in every particular; he is now rooming at my house and I 
thus have ample opportunity to observe. In his work as a student 
he is punctual, inåustrious and studious attending weel to his work. 
He is doing is work well.

Respectfully,

** W.O. BAILEY, Sec. 
Angola, Indiana, June 6, 1912.

To The Guardian of Mr. Luk:

Mr. S. C. Luk is an excellent student and has aone all work 
under me in a most satisfactory manner. He does not waste any time.

Respectfully,

L. W. FAIRFIELD, Bice-Pres.

Angola, Indiana, June 8, 1912.

To whom it may Concern:

This certifies that Mr. Shiu C. Luk was a student in the 
Chemistry Department of the Tri-State College during the winter 
term of 1912 (12 weeks) and the spring term of 1912 112 weeks). 
completing the work of these two term.

Mr. Luk was a careful, attentive and industrious student 
and did satisfactory work. 
In all of his conduct he has been a real gentleman.

Very truly 
C. Č. SHERRARD,

Dean. Dept. of Chemistry,

Angola, Ind, June 11, 1912.

Dear friend:

Mr. Luk has asked me to write a statement of how he is 
getting along with his work. During the past term I have had Mr. 
Luk enrolled in my Physics and also in my Mechanical Drawing class. 
In each of these he has done fair work. The Physics has given him 
some trouble. Mr. Luk is a hard worker in class and also out of it 
so far as I have been able to observe.

Yours truly,

B. S. SCHUMAN
